Title: Are we in a GPT-4-style leap that evals can't see?
Description: Gemini 3 Pro's design capabilities and Opus 4.5's reduced babysitting needs represent a subtle but significant leap that traditional benchmarks completely miss.

Title: Lessons learned from contributing to PyTorch
Description: Some lessons i've learned while contributing to PyTorch

Title: The end of the road for kafka-delta-ingest
Description:
After five years in production kafka-delta-ingest at Scribd has been shut off
and removed from our infrastructure.
kafka-delta-ingest was the
motivation behind my team creating
delta-rs, the most successful open
source project I have started to date. With kafka-delta-ingest we achieved our
original stated goals and reduced streaming data ingestion costs by 95%. In
the time since however, we have further reduced that cost with even more
efficient infrastructure.

Title: Documentation For Prompts
Description: Prompts are taking over codebases. How do we maintain them?

Title: Self-hosting slides from sli.dev | Deveesh Shetty
Description: Selfhosting my slides on my VPS using nginx, with a detailed guide on how to setup a subdomain and nginx to serve your static files.

Title: Uncle Nerd Runs A Marathon
Description: Our 42 km Full Marathon Training turned out surprisingly successful! Let's look back and technically document everything that happened, over the past 6 months.

Title: Blog - What are microservices? (seriously)
Description:
I used to particupate in many discussions about microservices, but over time I began to notice one strange phenomena: when 10 people are talking about microservices every one of them has slightly different meaning of the word. It goes like this:
— Of course we use microservices. Our authorization lives in a separate microservice, game logic and stats live in the second microservices, and our PostgreSQL DB is a third microservice.
— Wait, but your main logic service is not really “micro”. And your PostgreSQL storage is neither, it’s handling hell lot of responsibilities.

Title: Why gRPC Uses HTTP2
Description: When Google introduced gRPC in 2015, one of the most significant architectural decisions was building it on top of HTTP/2 rather than the widely adopted HTTP/1.1. This was just about following some trend, but a deliberate choice that fundamentally shapes how gRPC performs and behaves.

Title: Timeline for Selling a Micro-SaaS
Description: A detailed timeline of selling a micro-SaaS on Acquire.com, including pricing strategies (and foibles) and lessons learned from building and selling a calorie tracker without a large audience.

Title: Migrating from Jekyll to Ghost Blog
Description: I decided to migrate my simple static Jekyll site to Ghost Blog: a powerful open-source blog and newsletter platform.

Title: It's Hard to Feel the AGI · Tensor Labbet
Writing a good CLAUDE.md
Description: `CLAUDE.md` is a high-leverage configuration point for Claude Code. Learning how to write a good `CLAUDE.md` (or `AGENTS.md`) is a key skill for agent-enabled software engineering.

Title: Migrating Dillo from GitHub
Description:
I would like to migrate the Dillo project away from
GitHub
into a new home which is more friendly to be used with Dillo and solves some of
its problems. This page summarizes the current situation with GitHub and why I
decided to move away from it into a self-hosted server with multiple mirrors in
other forges.

Title: The Math of Why You Can't Focus at Work
Description: Interruptions, recovery time, and task size: three numbers that determine if you'll get real work done. Interactive visualizations show the math behind bad days.
